moves.1. e4: The first move of Fried liver gambit.
moves.2. Nf3: Threatens the pawn with the knight.
moves.3. Bc4: Someone else sees an opportunity to use Fried liver gambit.
moves.4. Ng5: Someone else rejoices as he continues the Fried liver gambit.
moves.4... d5: The only way to stop losing a rook.
moves.5... Nxd5: Someone takes with the knight, obviously.
moves.6. Nxf7: Someone else takes the pawn, and now he is in the exact same position that Someone was in in the last game.
moves.7. Qf3+: Checks the king, threatening the knight.
moves.8. Nc3: And someone else replies like someone did!
moves.8... Nce7: Someone has managed to save his knight! :O
moves.9. d3: Wanting to get out the other bishop.
moves.9... g6: ? Should of done something else, something useful.
moves.10. Bg5: Pins the knight, that's one less piece protecting the knight on d5!
moves.10... Bg7: Should of played c6, because now, Someone else has won a knight!
moves.11... Qxe7: Takes back with the queen, should have been the king.
moves.12. Qxd5+: Someone else is back in the game!!
moves.13. Qf3+: Checks again, and now the king is forced to move into the middle of the board or lose a bishop!
moves.13... Kg5: Moves into the middle of the board.
moves.14. h4+: Checks the king, who has one option.
moves.14... Kh6: Retreats, and is now positively trapped!
moves.15. Qe3+: Not anymore. Someone else should have played g4.
moves.15... Kh5: Only free square, should have blocked.
moves.16... Bf6: Threatens the pawn, but it is no use, Someone has lost.
moves.17. Ng3+: Checks the king with the knight.
moves.18. Qf3#: CHECKMATE!!! Someone else has got his revenge! Again, this game shows you not to protect the knight with your king in that position.

gameName: Someone else's revenge!! SO vs. SOE II
opening: two knights defence (C57), Fegatello attack, Polerio defence
